feedback.Physical object: Included — A fossil is a discrete, tangible physical artifact preserved in matter.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: Excluded — Fossils form through natural geological processes, not human design.
feedback.Biological or biologically-inspired: Included — It is a remnant of an organism; its form is biologically derived.
feedback.Fixed/static: Included — Its form is preserved and unchanging.
feedback.Structural: Included — Often preserves skeletal or external anatomical structure.
feedback.Perceptible: Included — Visible and tactile; observed in museums, collections, or nature.
feedback.Material form: Included — Composed of mineralized or petrified matter.
feedback.Passive: Included — Fossils have no active function or behavior.
feedback.Purposeful / intentional: Excluded — Not made with purpose; an incidental result of natural processes.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: Excluded — Does not emit energy, data, or functional output.
feedback.Transforms or modifies internal state: Excluded — Static; no mutable internal condition.
feedback.Interacts with humans directly: Excluded — Observed or handled, but does not afford designed interaction.
feedback.Part of a larger system: Excluded — Once was part of a biological system, but no longer functionally embedded.
feedback.Autonomous in function: Excluded — No autonomous or active behavior.
feedback.System-critical: Excluded — Not critical to any system by default.
feedback.Symbolic / representational: Excluded — May be symbolically interpreted, but not inherently a symbol.
feedback.Communicative: Excluded — Does not encode or transmit communication.
feedback.Logical / rule-based: Excluded — Not an abstract logical system.
feedback.Hierarchical / modular: Excluded — Form may reflect organismal hierarchy, but the fossil is not a modular structure.
feedback.Behavior-guiding: Excluded — No influence on action or behavior.
feedback.Temporal: Included — Its identity is bound to historical/geological time; it exists *as* a trace of the past.
feedback.Contextual abstraction: Excluded — Not an abstraction; it is a specific preserved object.
feedback.Socially / culturally constructed: Excluded — Not a human-made social concept.
feedback.Defined by a group/system: Excluded — Categorized post hoc, but not defined by collective agreement.
feedback.Linked to identity or role: Excluded — Not used to signify social roles.
feedback.Regulated / governed: Excluded — Collecting may be regulated, but the object itself is not defined by regulation.
feedback.Teachable / transmissible: Excluded — Can be used in education, but not a medium of instruction in itself.
feedback.Visible: Excluded — Perceptible physically, but not socially or symbolically 'visible' per UHT standard.
feedback.Context-sensitive: Excluded — Meaning is fairly stable regardless of setting.
feedback.Widely known: Included — Fossils are globally recognized and commonly understood objects.

encoding_notes: This encoding frames the fossil as a naturally formed physical remnant of past biological life. While it has educational and scientific significance, only intrinsic traits — not attributed meanings — are included. Temporal relevance is marked due to its preserved, ancient identity.
